choices.answer: God becoming fully human
The body becoming a spirit
The trial and death of Christ
A fancy term for God

questions.question: What does the Incarnation help us to understand?

choices.answer: Human life is precious, can't be damaged and valued
Human life is alright, value can be affected by others
Human life has no value
Human life is controlled by what we can and can't do

questions.question: What does St. Paul say about our bodies?

choices.answer: Our bodies are temples
Our bodies look like God
Our bodies are more important than anything else
Our bodies are worth nothing

questions.question: How are we called to know God?

choices.answer: In our own unique way of understanding
By attending church and confession
We are not supposed to know God
In the same way as everyone else
The whole point of human existence
Is easier for some people
Is not possible for everyone
The reason we attend church

questions.question: Why should we care for our bodies?

choices.answer: We are members of the body of Christ
We will die if we don't
God won't love us if we don't
God will not dwell within us if we don't

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a way of thinking?

choices.answer: Church smart
People smart
Word smart
Sound smart

questions.question: What are emotions called in Christian writings?

choices.answer: Passions
Sins
Psalms
Insignificant
Help us make choices between good and evil
Make it harder to make decisions
Govern all our decisions
Make us indifferent to good and evil

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true

choices.answer: Emotions call us to turn to God
Emotions remind us that we need God
Jesus says relax and let our emotions guide us
Strong emotions means we have a choice to make
The rich and poor ate together
Everyone was treated equally everywhere
Men and women only sat together at banquets
Seating arrangements were super important

questions.question: Why did Jesus stand out back then?

choices.answer: He let everyone eat together with no social divisions
He didn't invite the poor to his banquets
He washed people's feet when he was at banquets
He treated the rich with more respect than the poor
You shall not kill
Honour your mother and father
You shall not steal
Respect your elders

questions.question: How does the 5th commandment relate to our lives?

choices.answer: Demands that we respect life entirely
Demands that we respect our parents no matter what
Demands that we never eat meat on Fridays
Demands that we treat the rich better than the poor

questions.question: What do the 7 ways of thinking/knowing have to do with our faith?

choices.answer: We use them to get to know God in our own way
We use them to fit in at church
We use them to guide our faith decisions
They have nothing to do with our faith
